intro: Laelia lawrenceana, commonly known as the Lawrence's orchid, is a species native to the high-altitude regions of Central and South America. It is a terrestrial orchid that typically grows in rocky or clay soils at elevations ranging from 2,000 to 4,000 meters. The plant produces a single, upright stem bearing several lance-shaped leaves and a raceme of fragrant, white to pale pink flowers. Its flowers are characterized by three elongated petals and a distinctive lip that is often darker in color. Laelia lawrenceana is well adapted to cold, dry climates and requires good drainage for optimal growth.
